author: Shannon Owens
text: 'I was extremely disappointed with the service. Had reservation on roof top and had to clean our own table before sitting down. There was a waitress behind the bar eating a whole meal who seemly had an attitude after we refused to move to a tighter section. I had a peach tea drink that tasted watered down and an over cooked burger with a bun that was hard as a rock. To make our experience worse the couple next to us spotted a rodent and had to move somewhere else
column5: making us very paranoid. I would not recommend this place to anyone. I drove over 4 hours to meet my friends at this place to have such an awful experience.'

author: Christine Thomas
text: "Excellent experience! Server was friendly and attentive. I started with a cool Frose'. The Bistro Burger was cooked perfectly. And the sweet potatoes fries were served nice and hot. Delicious! I would definitely  go back. Plenty on the menu to try."

text: 'The rooftop restaurant is everything. The service is great food was delicious & drinks were too. The waitress & waiters are awesome. Perfect spot for small events or group gatherings.'

text: "Stay away from here

column6: security at the door told us our ID's were fake. Waited an hour for the police to come just to tell them our IDs are real. Manager was rude and unhelpful throughout the entire time. If you're going to hire security make sure they are trained enough to know the difference between a real and a fake ID."

author: PX
text: "We dined here recently for a quick bite and were not impressed. The service was great but the food was overpriced and unimpressive for what we spent. I would recommend for drinks on the rooftop or patio but don't waste your money on the food."

text: 'It is still a Hoboken staple. Been going there for over 20 yrs. Just had brunch at the rooftop..hearty and also delicate food.\nTuna tartare...delicious with the guacamole and mache combination.'

author: Dhatrish Rajdev
text: "A brunch can also be a flavorsome experience and not just another swallow-your-food-with-booze story. Every dish we ordered was perfectly garnished and seasoned to create a good balance. Can't comment on authenticity but my favorite was Huevos rancheros. It's the combination of flavors that create magic in a dish and that was present aplenty."

text: 'The food and service were great! A very cute place for a nice date ‚ù§Ô∏è'

The food menu was disappointing not many options. I understand rooftop bars may limit their menu but I feel like more appetizer options should be included'

author: kendall thomas
text: "This place used to be great but it's fallen from grace
column5:
for example:
A 'brunch special' $10 Bloody Mary is a water cool cup size
The $14 frittata is just scrambled eggs with cooked veggies and goat cheese on top
The $16 brisket burger has no brisket in it
The $11 Caesar salad salad isn't dry
column6:
still watered down

We would have sent back but took 1.5 hrs to out an order in and then over an hour for our food.

I used to come here all the time pre.covid and dinner was delish but this isn't even diner worthy food

author: Gabby Aviles
text: 'No idea how the food tastes because the waitress ‚Äúforgot to put my order through‚Äù and by the time they finally realized the kitchen was already closed. All my friends got their food except me. The waitress who made the mistake did not face me to apologize but chose to send a coworker instead who very politely tried to get at least a salad but was told no because again the kitchen was closed already she then offered to ‚Äúget me something from the pizza place next door‚Äù
column5: as to which I said no because again
column6: she did not make the mistake. I understood. Anyone can make a mistake fine. My friends and boyfriend felt very bad so they decided to take her up on the offer and get at least some pizza from the place next door. He informed the waitress whom said it was fine and we proceeded to get the food. On our way back in the person who checks ids refused to let us in bc no outside food was allowed. We tried to explain what happened but
column8: he cut us off saying no
column9: I asked him to please go ask the waitress and he responded with ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt care what she told you
column10: I said no‚Äù so my boyfriend proceeded to getting the waitress so she could explain and even tho she tried
column11: the Man still refused to listen to her. Poor girl had to go get
column13: was the manager so he could finally get through this hard headed employee.\nIn the end they gave us 50% off and a very bad experience.'

author: saba an
text: 'Ambience was good.  Apetizers were fine. The actual entrees left me unimpressed. I would have to say that the portion size as good. The chicken entree was huge chunks of fried chicken buried under salad. Shrimp languini was slightly better but not very flavorful.'

author: Eric Hammer
text: 'First off
column5: City Bistro is (in normal times) a great drinking spot. The rooftop is always a great time especially in warm weather (although I must admit the TV management could be improved by making sure the best games are playing
column6: but that‚Äôs a personal issue that I can get over). Id argue it‚Äôs the best happy hour spot in the city.\n\nI‚Äôve been here to eat twice now
column7:
first time for dinner on a whim and most recently brunch. I‚Äôve been pleasantly surprised both times.

Brunch with a friend this weekend was excellent. He ordered the French toast which was soft on the inside and crunchy on the outside thanks to the cornflakes.

I opted for the burger and it was excellent. I like a classic burger and that‚Äôs exactly what this was. Brioche bun
column12: and a pickle spear as the proverbial cherry on top. Sweet potato fries were above average too.\n\nWe also put down a few mimosas a piece because
column14: brunch.\n\nI can confidently say that City Bistro has one of the better burgers in Hoboken.'

author: Mabel Avalos
text: 'This place is a decent spot to get a quick bite to eat
column5: if you have to. Or to have a brunch with someone you don‚Äôt like. But the food and options are very bland. The places looks nice inside but decor is the most interesting thing it has going for itself. The staff members are okay. But a big concern is how little it is inside. Unfortunately for everyone safety I would suggest distancing the tables more due to COVID.'

author: Hafsa Aydƒ±n

I can go on and on but who ever is read will get the idea. There are many other nice places around so stay away if you can.'
